properties.headline: Flood Warning issued January 28 at 6:35PM PST by NWS Seattle WA
properties.description:
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in
Washington...
Skokomish River At Potlatch affecting Mason County

Flooding continues on the Skokomish River with heavy rainfall
expected at times through this week with additional rises
likely on the Skokomish River at Potlach.

The Flood Warning continues for
The Skokomish River At Potlatch
* Until further notice.
* At  5:30 PM Tuesday the stage was 17.1 feet.
* Flood stage is 16.5 feet.
* Minor flooding is occurring and Minor flooding is forecast to continue.
* Forecast...The river has crested and will continue to fall.
* Impact...At 16.5 feet, the Skokomish River will cause widespread
flooding of pasture lands, with water flowing quickly over West
Bourgault Road and Skokomish Valley Road.
properties.instruction:
Do not drive cars...vans...or trucks through flooded areas...this is
the cause of most flood related deaths in Washington. Be alert for
rapid changes and monitor developments by listening to NOAA Weather
radio or other local media.
